intro: Hieracium abundifloccum, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, soft hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with a rough texture and serrated edges, while its flowers are bright yellow with a distinctive, fluffy appearance. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, pastures, and along roadsides.
